newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Christopher criticises France; US supports Africa.
newsitem.headline: Christopher criticises France; US supports Africa.

text.p: U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher on Saturday said the United States would not "walk away from Africa" and indirectly criticised France for trying to maintain "exclusive patronage" on the continent.
In a speech prepared for delivery at Witwatersrand University, he said much of Africa was at a fragile point and needed "the support of all its many friends, not the exclusive patronage of a few".
Christopher, on the fourth stop of a five-nation African tour, said: "All nations must cooperate, not compete, if we are going to make a positive difference in Africa's future."
"The time has passed when Africa could be carved into spheres of influence or when outside powers could view whole groups of states as their private domain," he added.
The comments, unusually strong for Christopher, followed France's critical review of his tour of sub-Saharan Africa, the first he has made to the region since taking office in 1993.
